thread.title: Baylor punishes Tech with ground-heavy 63-35 victory
thread.title_full: Baylor punishes Tech with ground-heavy 63-35 victory - San Antonio Express-News

author: Tim Griffin
title: Baylor punishes Tech with ground-heavy 63-35 victory
text:
Photo: Tony Gutierrez, STF / Associated Press Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Baylor running back Johnny Jefferson, center left, and offensive tackle Spencer Drango, center right, celebrate a touchdown on a running play by Jefferson as Texas Tech defensive back Jah'Shawn Johnson (7) and defensive back Keenon Ward (15) walk back to the sideline in the second half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. Baylor won 63-35. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez)
Photo: Tony Gutierrez, STF / Associated Press Baylor running back Johnny Jefferson, center left, and offensive... Baylor punishes Tech with ground-heavy 63-35 victory 1 / 1 Back to Gallery ARLINGTON — Spencer Drango loves when observers outside the Baylor program consider them a pass-first team.
Sure, Baylor has been one of the nation’s most potent passing teams since Art Briles took over in Waco.
But the Bears can run the ball a little bit, too.
“They come in thinking we’re pass happy and we come in and hit them in the mouth,” said Drango, a senior offensive tackle who leads the offensive line. “If they are expecting us to throw for 700 yards, we can do it. But we can also run for 400 or 500. I definitely enjoy it when they think we’re just pass happy.”
That running game was on display Saturday at AT&T Stadium as the Bears rushed for 368 yards en route to a 63-35 victory over Texas Tech .
For more, visit ExpressNews.com
